Now note three forms of excess we find the first is a gap
So a price gap is where the market opens substantially high or low from the closing price
these gaps can be created for a fundamental or a technical reason and
Note technical gaps are far more likely to be filled than fundamental gaps and the basic premise is very simple
When a market technically gaps, or when a market gaps as a result of say overnight moves
or maybe aggressive sort of price response from the previous day, or an aggressive open
strategy, well a lot of the time these gaps will be filled as there's very little fundamentals
underlying the move.
don't need to fill for one, they don't always fill, and they can actually take sometimes

The second form of access is tails, now we get two types of tails, the first is the invisible
tail.
Now it's a relatively simple but very important sort of market access to consider.
When we have a normal tail you would be able to identify quite easily on a volume profile
because it sticks out.
Now an invisible tail doesn't quite stick out that easily, but all an invisible tail
is, is it's a very aggressive auction within the day's range.
It's where market very quickly initiates from one point to another and continues to initiate.
An invisible tail is nothing more than an initiative move taken by the buyers or sellers
but within the already established range of the day.
And I will show you an example of this in the next slide, so do not worry too much if
you don't understand the invisible tail.
Then obviously the open tail or what we like to think of as the high or the low or the
extreme tail, an example we saw back in part 6.
Now the open tail is the tail left within the first hour of trade, so the initial
as it shows us early confidence in the market to move toward the upside or to the downside.
So now we've discussed these three basic forms of excess, the reason we're discussing them
is because these forms of excess give us early identifiers, they give us an early
indication of potential movement toward the up or the downside.
